body:
### Problem

I'm not sure it's an issue with svelte-language-server or neovim, I will report it to svelte side when I find it unrelated to here

### Steps to reproduce

1. `npm init svelte`
2. press enter on every prompt
3. `npm install`
4. `nvim --clean -u minimal_init.lua src/routes/+page.svelte`
5. check there is no invalid lines in `:changes`
6. format file `:lua vim.lsp.buf.format()`
7. `:changes` and there's a invalid line on line 60 (which is next line after last line) 

### Expected behavior

not make invalid lines changes 

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.9.4

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

no native lsp support

### Operating system/version

Archlinux

### Terminal name/version

st

### $TERM environment variable

st-256color

### Installation

pacman -S neovim


### minimal config
<details>
<summary>Details</summary>

```lua
for name, url in pairs{
	"https://github.com/neovim/nvim-lspconfig/",
} do
  local install_path = vim.fn.fnamemodify('lspconfig/'..name, ':p')
  if vim.fn.isdirectory(install_path) == 0 then
    vim.fn.system { 'git', 'clone', '--depth=1', url, install_path }
	print ("Installing " .. install_path)
  end
  vim.opt.runtimepath:append(install_path)
end

local lspconfig = require('lspconfig')
lspconfig.svelte.setup {}
```


</details>
title: lsp formatting svelte files results in invalid `changes`
